JobFullDesc: As one of the world’s leading asset managers, we are solely dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. If you're looking for challenging work, smart colleagues, and a global employer with a social conscience, explore your potential at InvescoYour RoleThe Portfolio Analyst is responsible for producing reporting and analysis of portfolio analytics and attribution for the broad range of Invesco’s fixed income products. The position will play a key role in the development of both current and next generation portfolio analysis solutions throughout Invesco.You will be responsible for: Creating, interpreting, and performing in-depth analysis of performance attribution results for Invesco’s global fixed income products (including ETFs, retail, and institutional accounts). Building an in-depth understanding of the intricacies and management philosophy of Invesco products and business lines. Developing a fundamental understanding of the fixed income attribution and risk models used by the Global Performance Measurement and Risk group. Communicating with all levels of business across Invesco to assess their analytical and attribution needs and utilizing this feedback to create solutions. Assisting with the identification, design, development, and implementation of new and existing analytical tools to improve the ability to explain performance attribution and characteristics of portfolios. Assessing the importance of any given request or problem, managing the flow of information surrounding the item, and ensuring proper resolution. Utilizing quantitative tools to support ad-hoc requests. Assisting in the reporting and analysis of portfolio and benchmark characteristics (including top holdings, sector/country breakdowns, growth/valuation metrics, etc.). Assisting in the oversight and daily maintenance of portfolio analytics and attribution systems. Supporting the needs of the Performance Measurement & Risk Group as well as additional analytics and attribution stakeholders across the organization. (Investments, Product Management, Marketing, etc.). Participating in projects to improve global efficiencies.The experience you bring: A minimum of two years of related experience in portfolio analysis, portfolio analytics, or performance measurement. Must have a fundamental understanding of market standard attribution models and analytical calculations and methodologies. Prior experience with fixed income and derivative instruments. Prior experience in Operations, Accounting, or Finance in the securities/investment industry preferred. Strong technology skills including the knowledge of investment analytics/attribution applications (such as FactSet, Barra, Aladdin, Bloomberg, Eagle, StyleAdvisor, etc.) preferred. Programming skills such as Python, R, and/or VBA desirable. Ability to collaborate and contribute in a team environment. Ability to conduct complex analysis and present data in a meaningful way. Ability to handle multiple tasks, prioritize work, meet deadlines and concentrate on detailed information. Must be analytical, open-minded, flexible, and able to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment Ability to articulate responses to all levels within the organization (entry level to senior executive). Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field. CFA, CIPM, or MBA desirable.What’s in it for you?Our people are at the very core of our success.
